sections.title: Summary of Qualifications
sections.content: Graduated from Queens College with a degree in Computer Science, I've cultivated a sincere passion for technology and a genuine curiosity for solving complex challenges. Proficient in languages like Python, JavaScript, SQL, Java, and Kotlin, my approach is always learning-oriented and detail-focused. I strive to bring thoughtful solutions and a collaborative spirit to every project, aiming to contribute meaningfully while continuously growing in the ever-evolving field of technology.

subSections.subTitle: Technical Expertise
points: Proficient in Python, JavaScript, SQL, Java, Kotlin; pursuing AWS Certified Developer Associate certification. Experienced in Android development, web design (Figma, Webflow), and data management (MySQL, Data Analysis, Excel workbooks, Microsoft offices, Power-BI, Tableau, Data mining, Data warehousing, Big Data).

subSections.subTitle: Project Leadership
points: Successfully managed and implemented IT projects during internships at NYC Departments of Veterans' Services and Sanitation, showcasing skills in technical documentation, inventory management, and IT solutions.

subSections.subTitle: Professional Development
points: Demonstrated continuous learning and application in software development, database management, and technical support, with a strong focus on efficiency and process improvement. Fast and curious learner with attention to details.

subSections.subTitle: Training and Teamwork
points: Skilled in training, leading teams; boosting productivity and knowledge in tech and IT environments.

subSections.subTitle: NYC Department of Veterans' Services (DVS)
points: Tasked with leading and managing diverse IT projects, focusing on the development of innovative solutions and support strategies to enhance organizational effectiveness.
Assisted in building a priority-based IT solution and developing a token-based website and maintained system integrity following the SDLC.
Excelled in creating and implementing technical documentation and best practices.
Spearheaded data cleanup processes for enhanced system accessibility.
Proven ability in troubleshooting, offering effective solutions, and training new staff and interns in IT solutions and inventory management.

subSections.subTitle: NYC Department of Sanitation (DSNY)
points: Responsible for enhancing IT documentation and inventory management processes, contributing to the optimization of internal systems, and improving user experiences.
Contributed to the development of a secure Android application in Kotlin.
Collaborated with senior developers to code, test, and implement application programs.
Excelled in drafting and applying IT documentation and standards.
Directed comprehensive data cleanup for system accessibility improvement.
Skilled in troubleshooting and training staff in IT solutions and documenting inventory control.

subSections.subTitle: Queens College City of NY
points: Responsible for the critical maintenance and preparation of laboratory environments, ensuring streamlined academic operations and the meticulous management of supplies and equipment.
Maintained and meticulously managed laboratory inventory, ensuring the accuracy and up-to-date status of information.

subSections.subTitle: Queens College of the City University of New York
subSections.role: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science
